item.title: Report E-2024120239
item.description:
Report E-2024120239

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-16T12:32:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-10
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XNW, experienced a UN1805 “pH Down” release from a 6-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contactors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to 10’ x 10’ area of the concrete dock floor. The release occurred due to being crushed. The damaged jug was placed into a 30-gallon poly drum prior to contactors arrival. The crew cleaned the impacted area with soda ash and absorbents. All impacted absorbents and debris were containerized into a 15-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024120160
item.description:
Report E-2024120160

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-10T12:24:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-16
  • City: CASTLETON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer it was discovered that two pails on a pallet of 16 were leaking from the top. Further investigation revealed that it appeared that freight loaded on top of the pails by the shipper had crushed two of the pail closures damaging them contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as were the damaged pails.
